intro: Aquilegia olympica, commonly known as the Olympic columbine, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Greece. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its striking, spurred petals that come in shades of red, purple, and white. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features compound leaves with three to five leaflets. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade, often found in alpine and subalpine habitats. The flowers bloom in early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
